column5: NTA, but is this a common interaction between you two? I‚Äôm not going to jump right to ‚Äúleave him‚Äù if this is an uncommon occurrence but it really feels like we might be missing a large part of the picture here. His reactions definitely make him TA and isn‚Äôt really a normal way to react to a conversation about lunch...
Hi! I would love instructions on how to join too, when you get a chance!
In the cross post they said they didn‚Äôt have to leave their home to do it, so yeah, seems like they did it themselves. That and I like to hope no professional piercer would use this jewelry.

I get feeling defensive but the fact that you did this yourself really is not a strong argument here. It was an impulsive and probably not great decision. There really is no reason to NEED a piercing so badly that you can‚Äôt wait for a professional piercer to be available. If you‚Äôd waited they would‚Äôve been able to use correct jewelry and procedures where the risk of rejection and infection is lower. It just wasn‚Äôt a good idea to do this yourself. I‚Äôm not trying to attack you, but honestly if you‚Äôre asking for piercing advice mine would be to take it out, let it heal, and get it done professionally in a few months when you can.
When my hands are getting really bad I slather them in aquaphor, cover them in socks, and let it soak in while I‚Äôm sleeping. It helps so much!
I think a vertical labret would balance out your setup a little more so you don‚Äôt have a lot of piercings very close together, but really either would look great!

YTA. Very lightly, but given that she‚Äôs moved in to a place that was previously only yours, I think it was probably a big adjustment for her to feel that she actually has ownership over it too, and that she‚Äôs not just a guest. Keeping a part of the place a secret probably reinforces the feeling that you see the apartment ultimately as your own, not shared.

This is exactly what I‚Äôm trying to remind myself right now. My mom passed away last week. I‚Äôm back to working (remotely) and holding myself to the same standards that I was a few weeks ago. I feel like I‚Äôm slacking. But I just can‚Äôt do as much, even though before I could. Your ‚Äúbest‚Äù absolutely changes. We only have a finite amount of energy and headspace to dedicate to things. If you‚Äôre going through something that takes a lot of emotional energy, you just don‚Äôt have as much to dedicate to work, projects, etc. it‚Äôs hard to be okay with that.
Good thing that‚Äôs what I went with!! I love them

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt think you‚Äôd be okay with it so I did it without you knowing‚Äù

This is not endearing or a way to show affection in any way. He deliberately decided that his desires were more important than your boundaries. I would strongly advise you against forgiving him - if he‚Äôs willing to lie about this and not respect your boundaries here, what else is he willing to disregard?

That‚Äôs fair. I do think there‚Äôs a way it could‚Äôve been communicated sooner without a big blow up, but probably would depend on their resolution and communication styles. Though given where they‚Äôre at now maybe that‚Äôs exactly how it would‚Äôve turned out if the roommate would‚Äôve done it sooner.

EAB - Ultimately to have your girlfriend stay for 3 weeks without a previous discussion with your roommate is very disrespectful of the shared space. I understand why she stayed, and given that there‚Äôs a global pandemic it‚Äôs pretty understandable that you‚Äôd need to change your plans. 

But pandemic doesn‚Äôt excuse the need for communication. You should‚Äôve had a conversation with your roommate before your girlfriend rescheduled her flight again, given that it isn‚Äôt just your place. And he shouldn‚Äôt have said that he was alright with it and let it boil for two weeks before talking about it.
That‚Äôs amazing! So proud of your resolve. You‚Äôve got this.

Is the gift something that she would notice if it were missing? Given the strained/not very open relationship with her I definitely understand and agree with the suggestions here to resell it on your own- you don‚Äôt have to explain yourself to her if you don‚Äôt want to. But if it‚Äôs something that she‚Äôll ask about and notice if you no longer have, is it worth possibly distancing the relationship further?

Agreed. We had someone from Optimum come out a few weeks ago. He took one look at the router that THEY supplied and said this was a ‚Äúknown issue‚Äù with the router and we need to buy our own. Or wait for them to fix the issue, but he had no timeline. 

Glad we have a known issue with equipment that they never told us about, even when we called several times.
Hahaha oh! Well, looks good!

Holy hell you‚Äôre gorgeous!
Are those tattoos on your face or makeup?

Agreed, YTA. I find it difficult to believe you just stumbled upon this information, anyways. Were you actively seeking it out? Seems like you would‚Äôve been dissatisfied with any answer you received from that, given that ‚Äú5th cousin‚Äù is not even a thing, and shared no DNA. 

Is there an actual issue with her fianc√©? Did something else cause you to grasp at some reason to pull your funding from the wedding? Seems like it.

I don‚Äôt know that any of this necessarily means she‚Äôs interested. I tend to be that affectionate with my closest friends and I definitely don‚Äôt mean anything romantic by it.

That said- should it matter? Cheating with a woman is still cheating. Gender of the coworker doesn‚Äôt matter at all in this. I think the better question here would be what‚Äôs happening in your marriage that makes you feel you need to seek affection outside of it, and how can you fix that? Seems the beat place to put your energy.
I hope you get them back at some point!
Ahh I looked them up and they look great too! Too many choices.. I might just have to wing it day-of at this point and see why I decide, I like them all!
I‚Äôve thought about that too. I heard that might tend to look better on curvier women? I‚Äôm very thin and a C cup so I was unsure it‚Äôd really have the same effect. Thoughts?

Thank you. So much. I told my best friend today because I feel like I‚Äôm not making this up. It feels good to have some support here and she‚Äôs lovely. It‚Äôs going to take a long time and I don‚Äôt know how I‚Äôll see this person everyday and get over this but I think this was my start of figuring it out, after denying it for 7 months. 

I‚Äôm very grateful to you all. I needed this.

I feel like I‚Äôve reacted worse in the situation to people who are on the periphery than maybe I‚Äôm proud of. But you‚Äôre right, thank you. No one super knows how to react in this situation I guess. 

Gunna tell my best friend today I think. She‚Äôs the only one I know is safe to tell/will be on my side no matter what so... we‚Äôll start there.

Thanks for everyone‚Äôs validation. I think I needed to know I wasn‚Äôt blowing it out of proportion before telling people here what‚Äôs up.

Definitely a major red flag that she made someone up and felt that was the only way to get your attention. 

But also, if you both were in relationships at that time (as far as you knew), was it really appropriate for you two to be discussing the things about your SOs that you did? I think that both of you seem to have crossed some significant boundaries here. Might be best for you both to have someone that you‚Äôre more secure with and don‚Äôt feel like you need to text ex‚Äôs, make up boyfriends, etc just to talk to each other.

Edit: I‚Äôm bad at typing apparently.
Thank you. Sharing it here was helpful. I think I‚Äôll be able to tell non strangers soon.

The one person I fully explained to about what happened didn‚Äôt seem to understand the gravity of how I felt about it and was still very confused about why I act the way I do around him. Just hard to believe anyone else will see it differently. He puts on a good front.
Valid point. Thank you. I just needed to hear this from someone other than myself.

How long ago did you take the piercing out?

What most people refer to as ‚Äúkeloids‚Äù are just irritation bumps and should go away with proper care, but it could take some time. They‚Äôre pretty common especially with an industrial so most likely that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre dealing with. 

Actual keloids are genetic and will only go away with surgery, so I wouldn‚Äôt expect that to get smaller. But those are much more rare than irritation bumps.

Yeah.. ESH. She shouldn‚Äôt be taking for granted how much you babysit or throwing that card in her face.

But also... instead of have a rational discussion about how you felt about it you just called your daughter a bitch..? Seems like you both need to figure out how to effectively speak to each other.

NTA. I find it very very strange that the apartment complex A) didn‚Äôt mention this when you moved in and B) allows a policy to continue that cuts out half of its residents. I wonder if the management is so worried about coming off as sexist that they don‚Äôt know how to deal with telling the residents it‚Äôs not an ok policy.

It‚Äôs an unfair and shitty policy. I think a women‚Äôs hour is a great idea but at this point it‚Äôs basically a women‚Äôs only gym when it wasn‚Äôt intended to be. Do you have a residents board where you can start a discussion about it?
Just keep doing that! I know they‚Äôre a little bit annoying but getting them off would affect the healing process/roll back your progress. They‚Äôll come off naturally as the piercing heals.
What have you been doing to clean it so far?
Oh okay! I‚Äôve wondered about that. It looks great!

Do you take your vertical labret out to do lipstick?

Love your setup and your style!

Let her know that you love her and you‚Äôre there if she ever needs to talk. But even if she doesn‚Äôt, just make an effort to get her out of her head, and to SHOW that you‚Äôre around. Make plans with her, actively seek her out to spend time with. Sometimes when people are struggling, it‚Äôs hard to actually feel it when people say you‚Äôre not alone. Help her feel that through your actions.

NAH. You aren‚Äôt ever obligated to donate to a cause for whatever reason and it‚Äôs unfair for your friend to expect you to, or to take it for granted. Regardless of the reason, you have been incredibly supportive and are always within your right to say no.

However, no one reacts rationally in that kind of situation and your friend is going through a very difficult time. While she absolutely shouldn‚Äôt be putting it on other people, I would guess she has a lot of misdirected anger and is feeling pretty lost right now, so I‚Äôm gunna say she‚Äôs not TA either. 

I think the brother being on pills is a little irrelevant to the donation issue at hand, since your reasoning for not wanting to donate doesn‚Äôt change that you shouldn‚Äôt be obligated to do so. 

However, he absolutely made a mistake, but that doesn‚Äôt mean he‚Äôs less worthy of medical care. He needs help, but he doesn‚Äôt deserve to die and his family doesn‚Äôt deserve to be in a financial hole that they can‚Äôt climb out of. He certainly should face consequences for his actions, but not this kind. There‚Äôs a lot of shame that comes with addiction and the family probably doesn‚Äôt know how to navigate that yet. You have a right to be mad about the circumstances of the accident, especially given your background, but it might be helpful to try to understand that the brother probably has some mental illness/addiction that lead to this. And regardless, he‚Äôs still important to your friend.

I am going through the same exact situation. Honestly questioning if I wrote this and forgot.

Thanks for the new outlook. Love this
Lol thank you! üòÅ

I agree, I think the friends part here is what makes FWB pretty great. It can be hard to balance that kind of casual relationship though, if you get too emotionally close. That‚Äôs why a lot of FWB end up turning into feelings.

So, absolutely should be someone that you enjoy being around and are comfortable doing other things with aside from sex. But they don‚Äôt have to be (and maybe shouldn‚Äôt be) someone you are emotionally close to. Keep it light.

YTBF. It sounds like you knew your friend originally planned this trip with the intention of hanging out with this girl. I‚Äôd be interested to know how he presented the trip to you when he invited you later.

But ultimately, you CAN help it. You can control your actions even if you‚Äôre into someone. Don‚Äôt sell yourself short and act like you can‚Äôt.

Please ignore this other comment. I‚Äôm here if you need someone to talk to. I understand how difficult it is to not really be able to imagine a future... but your current circumstances aren‚Äôt perpetual. They can and will change. 

The suicide hotline (tel:1-800-273-8255) would be a great place to start. My therapist has also been enormously helpful, maybe you could find someone to talk to.

Edit: other comment was deleted. Not sure why anyone felt it appropriate to post in the first place, but glad it‚Äôs gone
My brother passed away January 2018. He was my favorite person on the planet. Been almost a year and a half and I‚Äôm honestly not sure how I‚Äôve done it.

Maybe I‚Äôm the odd one out here, and if you have other resources that help you then obviously that‚Äôs a great option.

But I just wanted to say that there is absolutely no shame in taking a break from school to focus on your mental health. That‚Äôs not only a valid, but a very brave option. There‚Äôs nothing that says you can‚Äôt go back, and your health is ALWAYS more important.
